sect1.title: How Firewall Builder works with Cisco IOS Router Access Lists
sect1.para: Conceptually Firewall Builder works the same way no matter what type of firewall is being configured. Firewall Builder is based on the idea of using objects to represent rule elements, such as IP networks Host addresses, and then using these objects to define firewalll rules.

When a Cisco IOS Router is configured as a firewall in Firewall Builder after the firewall rules have been created for that device Firewall Builder will generate a configuration file that contains all the Cisco CLI commands required to implement the user defined security policy. This configuration file can also include information required to configure interfaces, static routes and other configuration options.

Once the configuration file has been created Firewall Builder can use the secure SSH and SCP protocols to transfer the configuration to the Cisco IOS Router firewall and to activate the generated configuration, or user's can manually copy-and-paste the generated configuration file onto a command line session.

figure.title: Basic Workflow for Configuring IOS Router Firewall with Firewall Builder

note.para: Firewall Builder supports creating access lists and static routes for Cisco IOS Routers. Configuration of NAT rules is not supported at this time.
